title: 111_hr5478
content: The "Green Railcar Enhancement Act of 2010" is a new law that provides a tax credit for freight railcar replacement or modernization under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Green Railcar Enhancement Act of 2010" offers a tax credit for replacing or modernizing freight railcars. The credit is 25% of the basis of qualified freight railcars placed in service and rebuild expenditures. Qualified freight railcars must meet capacity or fuel efficiency requirements. The "Green Railcar Enhancement Act of 2010" provides a tax credit for replacing or modernizing freight railcars. To qualify, a freight railcar must meet capacity or fuel efficiency requirements, which can be met by certifying the removal or rebuilding of another railcar. The "Green Railcar Enhancement Act of 2010" offers a tax credit for upgrading freight railcars to improve capacity or fuel efficiency. The rebuilding of a railcar by the taxpayer must result in a significant enhancement in capacity or fuel efficiency, and ownership of the railcar is not necessary as long as there is a binding agreement for removal or rebuilding. The "Green Railcar Enhancement Act of 2010" provides a tax credit for qualified freight railcar rebuild expenditures that result in at least an 8 percent increase in capacity or fuel efficiency. The expenditure must be properly chargeable to a capital account and coordinated with other credits. The tax credit for qualified freight railcar rebuild expenditures under the "Green Railcar Enhancement Act of 2010" includes basis adjustment and sale-leaseback provisions. The basis of the railcar is reduced by the amount of the credit allowed, and sale-leaseback conditions apply if the railcar is sold and leased back within 3 months of being placed in service. The tax credit for qualified freight railcar rebuild expenditures includes basis adjustment and sale-leaseback provisions. If a railcar is sold and leased back within 3 months of being placed in service, it shall be treated as originally placed in service not earlier than the date it is used under the leaseback. The tax credit for qualified freight railcar rebuild expenditures includes basis adjustment and sale-leaseback provisions. If a railcar is sold and leased back within 3 months of being placed in service, it shall be treated as originally placed in service not earlier than the date of the last sale. Recapture of the credit may be required under regulations prescribed by the Secretary. The tax credit for qualified freight railcar rebuild expenditures includes basis adjustment and sale-leaseback provisions. The Secretary may develop reporting requirements for taxpayers utilizing this credit. The section does not apply to railcars acquired or with at least 50% of rebuilding completed after December 31, 2011. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include a new paragraph for the freight railcar replacement or modernization credit under section 45R. Coordination with Section 55 is also adjusted to include the credit determined under section 45R. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections for subpart D of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include a new item after section 45Q for the freight railcar replacement or modernization credit under section 45R. The amendments made by section 45R for freight railcar replacement or modernization credit apply to property placed in service after December 31, 2009.
